docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican House bill is not reform: it does little to reduce the number of uninsured, and much of the savings on premiums comes from reduced coverage.
docs.snippet: The Republican House bill is not reform: it does little to reduce the number of uninsured, and much of the savings on premiums comes from reduced coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Vote counters say they are confident they will have the numbers when the House floor vote begins Saturday.

headline.main: House Democrats Seek Allies for Health Care Vote
headline.print_headline: House Democrats Seek Allies for Health Care Vote

docs.snippet: Vote counters say they are confident they will have the numbers when the House floor vote begins Saturday.

byline.original: By CARL HULSE  and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

docs.lead_paragraph: If the health care system is overhauled, patients and practitioners alike will face a primary care bottleneck. An estimated 30 million newly insured people will begin making appointments for checkups and other routine care with physicians who are already stretched thin caring for existing patients. The increase in demand may well put an end to a simmering policy dispute over the circumscribed role of nurse practitioners in medical care. If tens of millions of new patients enter the health care system, it seems clear that nurse practitioners will be needed to perform many of the tasks now performed by physicians.

headline.main: Is a Nurse in the House?

docs.abstract: Patients and practitioners are likely to face primary-care bottleneck if health care system is overhauled, potentially ending debate over circumscribed role of nurse practitioners; prospect of tens of millions of new patients in health care system likely means that nurse practitioners would be needed to perform many tasks now done by physicians; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: While House Democratic leaders say they are confident they will have the 218 votes needed to pass major health care legislation this weekend, some Democrats, including several from Republican-leaning districts in the South, have announced that they will oppose the measure. With all 177 Republicans likely to oppose the health care bill, Democrats at most can afford to lose 40 of their 258 House members.

docs.lead_paragraph: While Democratic leaders say they are confident they will have the 218 votes needed to pass major health care legislation this weekend, a number of House Democrats, including several from Republican-leaning districts in the South, have announced that they will oppose the measure, which is President Obama's top domestic priority.
docs.abstract: A few House Democrats have announced their opposition to the health care bill. Democratic leaders say they nonetheless have the votes for the health care bill.
docs.snippet: A few House Democrats have announced their opposition to the health care bill. Democratic leaders say they nonetheless have the votes for the health care bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of demonstrators appeared on Capitol Hill on Thursday in opposition to the Democrats’ health care legislation.
docs.snippet: Thousands of demonstrators appeared on Capitol Hill on Thursday in opposition to the Democrats’ health care legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the hazards (or joys, depending on how you look at it) of being a journalist is that you end up on a lot of mailing lists. And so it was that a post I once wrote about the transgender wage gap earned me an influx of e-mail about transgender issues -- including an invitation to check out a site that wrote about financial advice for transgender people.
docs.abstract: The two steps that marginalized groups go through on their way to social equality: market desegregation and market resegregation.
